channel.title: Need tips on making a script less detectable
channel.description: What are some ways to make a SCAR script less detectable on Runescape? I need to know because I'm trying to make my own script, but I don't want it to be too obvious that im autoing. I'm going to use SRL includes for my script, so I know that I can use mmouse to move the mouse smoothly within random co-ordinates, and that I can use typesend to make it type in a more human-like fasion. Any other tips are appreciated.

item.title: Need tips on making a script less detectable
item.dc:creator: @omg_omg_omg omg omg omg
item.source: Need tips on making a script less detectable

item.title: Need tips on making a script less detectable
item.dc:creator: @exps35 exps35
item.description:
@exps35 wrote:

And don’t forget to use ‘Cases’.

They come in handy with randomizing your anti-ban, so that you don’t keep dropping your axe and saying “oops” every 45 seconds

I’ll show you examples if you need. I’m leaving right now though, so I’ll be back in a few hours.

Read full topic
item.source: Need tips on making a script less detectable

@omg_omg_omg wrote:

Thanks for the help guys!

item.source: Need tips on making a script less detectable

item.title: Need tips on making a script less detectable
item.dc:creator: @Ron Ron
item.description:
@Ron wrote:

Here’s something no one has tried or hardly ever tried.

Make the script purposely make mistakes and fix them. Such as when woodcutting, have it randomly start examine the equipment while woodcutting, and then for the hell of it, have it drop the axe. “Oops” says the script, and jumps right in to pick it up and continues woodcutting.

In a script that involves a lot of walking, have the player reach its destination in a number of different ways.

Look at this image I have drawn and look at all the different possibilities of getting to its point.

Hope that helps!

Read full topic
item.source: Need tips on making a script less detectable

item.title: Need tips on making a script less detectable
item.dc:creator: @Rune_Hacker1 Rune Hacker
item.description:
@Rune_Hacker1 wrote:

Use randomness in the mouse clicks, to move and click the mouse, use Mouse(x, y, 4, 4, True) or soemthign instead of ClickMouse. Moving the mouse is MMouse and make random wait times like wait(1000 + random(1000));

look though other good scripts and you can see what they use also.

Read full topic
item.source: Need tips on making a script less detectable
